docs.snippet: THE HAGUE, April 8.--The conference for the codification of international law threatens to be a failure in regard to two of the three planned conventions.
docs.lead_paragraph: THE HAGUE, April 8.--The conference for the codification of international law threatens to be a failure in regard to two of the three planned conventions.
docs.abstract: Amer women barred from Hague Peace Palace during dispute

headline.main: WORLD CODE OF LAW BLOCKED IN 2 PHASES; Third Committee at The Hague Struggles for Success on Status of Aliens. APPEAL MADE TO LEAGUE New Conference on Territorial Seas Asked--American Women Are Barred From Peace Palace. Nationality Protocols Adopted. Secretary Barred Women.

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 8.--Herbert Hoover, engineer, was honored by his fellows at the fifth anniversary banquet of the American Society of Mechanical Engineers this evening.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 8.--Herbert Hoover, engineer, was honored by his fellows at the fifth anniversary banquet of the American Society of Mechanical Engineers this evening.
docs.abstract: Amer Soc of Mech Engineers awards medals; s by Pres Hoover

headline.main: HOOVER RECEIVES ENGINEERS' MEDAL FOR PUBLIC SERVICE; Accepting First Award of Foundation Named for Him, HePraises Profession.URGES "ENGINEERING MIND"Government Problems RequireIts Patient Approach to "Distilled Truth," He Says.NOTED ENGINEERS ATTENDOrville Wright Is Among ThoseFrom Various Parts of World Honored by Awards. Members of Board of Award. HOOVER RECEIVES ENGINEERS' MEDAL Problems of Government. Emotional Factor Arises. Medals Are Awarded.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: THE HAGUE, April 10.--The nationality convention was adopted tonight in the form the drafting committee had given it by forty votes to one. This vote was cast by the chief American delegate, David Hunter Miller, who had stated that his government...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE HAGUE, April 10.--The nationality convention was adopted tonight in the form the drafting committee had given it by forty votes to one. This vote was cast by the chief American delegate, David Hunter Miller, who had stated that his government appreciated in the fullest degree the value and helpfulness of the discussions at this conference on nationality.
docs.abstract: U S defeated, 40 to 1, on nationality convention at Hague; comments

headline.main: AMERICA DEFEATED 40 TO 1 AT THE HAGUE; Conference on World Law Adopts Nationality Convention With No Other Opposition. WOMEN PLEASED AT STAND Recommendation for Study of Equality of Sexes in Choosing Is Approved 36 to 2. Later Signature Opposed. Says Women Must Write Treaty.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 10.--From a desk in the White House President Hoover talked today with Dr. Hipolito Irigoyen, President of Argentina, by radio-telephone, over 6,000 miles of land and water. They heard each other as clearly as in a conversation...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 10.--From a desk in the White House President Hoover talked today with Dr. Hipolito Irigoyen, President of Argentina, by radio-telephone, over 6,000 miles of land and water. They heard each other as clearly as in a conversation between Washington and Baltimore.
docs.abstract: Pres Hoover and Pres Irigoyen talk over radio

headline.main: IRIGOYEN ON RADIO TALKS WITH HOOVER; Argentine President Heard Plainly at White House Over 6,000Mile Radio Telephone Link.THEIR MEETING IS RECALLED American Executive Points to Advantages of Contacts MadePossible by Science. Irigoyen Deeply Impressed. Hoover Grateful for Reception. President Irigoyen's Reply.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times
